alert.note: Alert for Ascension; East Baton Rouge; Livingston (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 9:32PM CDT until June 20 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Ascension, East Baton Rouge, Livingston and West Baton Rouge. * WHEN...Until 1230 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 931 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baton Rouge, Baker, Denham Springs, Port Allen, Oak Hills Place, Walker, Westminster, Inniswold, Merrydale, Shenandoah, Village St. George, Old Jefferson, Brownfields, Gardere and Baton Rouge Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
